description: Packages whose business models are at risk due to AI tools

packages.name: tailwindcss
packages.note: AI can now generate high-quality UIs using Tailwind for free. Revenue from paid UI component kits (Tailwind UI) dropped significantly as AI tools like Claude and GPT can produce similar results.

packages.name: @tailwindcss/typography
packages.note: Part of Tailwind ecosystem affected by AI disruption to the core business model.

packages.name: @tailwindcss/forms
packages.note: Part of Tailwind ecosystem affected by AI disruption to the core business model.

packages.name: daisyui
packages.note: Component library whose value proposition is reduced when AI can generate custom components directly.

packages.name: headlessui
packages.note: Part of Tailwind Labs ecosystem, affected by broader AI disruption.

packages.name: heroicons
packages.note: Part of Tailwind Labs ecosystem, affected by broader AI disruption.

packages.name: prettier
packages.note: AI-generated code often comes pre-formatted, reducing the need for separate formatting tools.

packages.name: eslint
packages.note: AI assistants catch many issues during generation that linters would have flagged. Still essential but usage patterns changing.

packages.name: lodash
packages.note: AI can generate equivalent utility functions inline, reducing dependency on utility libraries.

packages.name: underscore
packages.note: Similar to lodash - AI reduces need for utility libraries.

packages.name: moment
packages.note: AI often suggests native Date APIs or generates date handling code directly.

packages.name: classnames
packages.note: Simple enough that AI generates equivalent code inline rather than suggesting the package.

packages.name: clsx
packages.note: Simple enough that AI generates equivalent code inline rather than suggesting the package.
